Han, Tom, Milt & Jim

I have not yet gotten a photo of the tsuba from the
owner. Will try soon.

The tsuba image was definitely much more batlike WITH
horns. Without looking too far, I found a similar one
in Hawley's Tsuba of Southern California book (page
116, tsuba 569). This one is much more clearly the Nue
of the Yorimasa story.

I felt the friend's tsuba was more likely the Chinese
God of Archery, but am now unsure. I have not found
any comparable images of the Chinese God of Archery on
the web, and need to see his tsuba again to be sure
memory has the right mental snapshot of the tsuba.


Curran
